newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq says US cruise missiles attacked Baghdad.
newsitem.headline: Iraq says US cruise missiles attacked Baghdad.

text.p: Iraq said the United States had fired missiles against military bases and civilian areas in the capital Baghdad on Wednesday evening.

"At 8.45 p.m. the American enemy directed its failing missiles against our military bases and civilian places and a number of them have fallen in Baghdad," Iraqi state television reported, quoting a statement by the general command of the Iraqi armed forces.

Earlier in Washington the Pentagon denied it had launched any attack against the Iraqi capital. Residents in Baghdad heard several large explosions, as well as anti-aircraft fire, but did not know what had caused them.
The Iraqi military statement said a number of people were killed in the attacks but did not say how many.
The statement called U.S. President Bill Clinton a "war criminal".
Iraqi air defence were able to shoot down many of the missiles, the statement said.
Clinton, speaking to reporters earlier in Washington shortly after reports of explosions in Baghdad, denied the United States had launched attacks against the capital.

The United States said it launched a total of 44 cruise missiles against military targets in southern Iraq early on Tuesday and on Wednesday morning following Iraq's military incursion against areas of Kurdish-held northern Iraq at the weekend.
